projects.name: GOV.UK
projects.summary: Building new templates, enhancing accessibility, and working with other frontend developers to consolidate and improve the frontend architecture across the UK government website.
projects.description: On joining GOV.UK I worked within a team of Frontend Developers to consolidate the frontend patterns on GOV.UK and move towards a componentised system. Now working embedded in development teams, I am able to iterate further on these components, while also implementing new designs, making improvements based on user research, and ensuring the site is accessible to all.
projects.skills: HTML, SASS, BEM, JavaScript, Ruby on Rails, RSpec, MiniTest

image.name: govuk.png
image.alt_text: A GOV.UK taxon page, displaying on desktop, tablet and mobile devices.

projects.name: Moodjar: A secure cognitive behavioural therapy application
projects.summary: Dissertation project exploring the use of secure technology to enhance communication between health professionals and patients within the health industry.
projects.description: Android and web application (with user and admin-facing interfaces) developed as a dissertation project for BSc Computing and Information Technology. Users were able to use the application as a mental health diary, which could be accessed by their chosen healthcare professional via a REST API querying a central encrypted database. This project was never made live, so a link cannot be provided.
projects.skills: Java, Android Fingerprint Authentication API, HTML, SASS, jQuery, CanvasJS, nodeJS, PostgreSQL, Data Encryption (AES-GCM)

image.name: moodjar.png
image.alt_text: Moodjar admin login interface shown on desktop. Mobile user interface shown on tablet, with options for users to select their current mood from a range of visual images. Mobile user login interface shown on smaller iPhone device.

projects.name: Castle Street Clinic
projects.summary: Website redesign for an osteopathy clinic.
projects.description: Castle Street Clinic required a newly designed website to replace their outdated one, which users found difficult to navigate. This redesign splits the extensive information into clear separate sections, making sure  users are able to find the information relevant to them. The design also introduced strong brand identity throughout to match the company logo and colour scheme.

image.name: csc.png
image.alt_text: Castle Street Clinic website shown on desktop, tablet and mobile devices.

projects.name: Sushi Lab
projects.summary: Website design for a new quick-service sushi restaurant based in Guildford.
projects.description: Simply provided with a company logo and the request that it be 'bold and exciting', this project uses bold brand colours paired with a clean design. A keen eye for detail was used here, with animated SVG icons, social media feed, and custom styling of Google Maps. Developed alongside Andy Smith.
projects.skills: HTML5, SCSS, SVG Animations, jQuery, RequireJS, Mustache, PHP, MySQL

image.name: sushilab.png
image.alt_text: Sushi Lab website shown on desktop, tablet and mobile devices.

projects.name: Book Management Application
projects.summary: Design and build of a web application to track reading over a long period of time. A user can monitor their progress against the 1001 Books to Read Before You Die (2008 edition).
projects.description: This web application is a personal project, allowing me to record progress against the 1001 Books to Read Before You Die. The site uses a populated database of all 1001 books which can be marked as 'Yet to be Started', 'In Progress' and 'Completed'. Books outside this list can also be recorded - the homepage dashboard shows progress plotted for both list and non-list books.
projects.skills: HTML5, SCSS, jQuery, Flot Graphs for jQuery, MySQL, PHP

image.name: books.png
image.alt_text: Books Management Application shown on desktop, tablet and mobile devices.
